Getting started with simple demos.name: Simple shapes
Getting started with simple demos.desc: The simplest demo, ever. Nothing is moving but it shows how to get started with the library.

Getting started with simple demos.name: Basic animation
Getting started with simple demos.desc: Shows how to animate the radius of a circle.

Getting started with simple demos.name: Mistify screen saver
Getting started with simple demos.desc: Shows a more complex demo using multiple lines

Getting started with simple demos.name: A Julia Fractal
Getting started with simple demos.desc: A graphical library without a fractal is not really a graphical library, isn't it?

Image drawing.name: Basic image drawing
Image drawing.desc: Demonstrates how to load an image from the disk and to display it on the screen.

Image drawing.name: Mirror an image
Image drawing.desc: Shows how draw a mirrored image and the various possibilities of it.

Image drawing.name: Rotate image, with animation
Image drawing.desc: Shows how to animation the rotation of a picture.

Image drawing.name: Draw an image with transparency (alpha)
Image drawing.desc: Shows how the alpha transparency of an image can be changed to make it more or less transparent.

Image drawing.name: Animated images and shapes
Image drawing.desc: Show that many images can be drawn simultaneously on the screen. The images are rotated and bounce around the screen. Click to change the rendered image.

Image drawing.name: Scrolling
Image drawing.desc: This demo demonstrates the usage of the scrolling technique which can be used to animate a game for instance.

Music, sound effects, text and fonts.name: Playing music
Music, sound effects, text and fonts.desc: You want to play a nice background music in your game? Want to know how to stop it or resume playing? This demo is for you!

Music, sound effects, text and fonts.name: Displaying text using various fonts
Music, sound effects, text and fonts.desc: If you want to display text in your game with various fonts, this is the demo to launch!

Advanced techniques.name: Scrolling your game
Advanced techniques.desc: Want to do a side-scroller game. Just look at this very complete demo to see how it can be done nicely using gdx2d.

Advanced techniques.name: Position interpolation
Advanced techniques.desc: Shows how to animate automatically from one value to another one, very simply.

Advanced techniques.name: Adding lights to a game
Advanced techniques.desc: If you want to create a special ambiance in your game, maybe using lights and shadows is a good idea. This demo demonstrates how it can be easily done in gdx2d

Advanced techniques.name: Rotating lights, animated
Advanced techniques.desc: Another demo on how to use lights, this time by making them move in circles!

Physics simulations.name: Dominoes
Physics simulations.desc: Enjoy looking at falling dominoes? This demo shows how to create basics physics objects and make them move.

Physics simulations.name: Falling balloons
Physics simulations.desc: A demo for soccer fans! Just interact with the screen to make balls fall. On Android, this demos uses the accelerometers.

Physics simulations.name: Obstacles with chain of objects
Physics simulations.desc: This demos shows how to create a chain of objects that are seen as obstacles for other physics objects

Physics simulations.name: Collisions notification
Physics simulations.desc: Demonstrates how objects can be informed when they collide against other objects.

Physics simulations.name: Physics joints - rotating joint
Physics simulations.desc: An object that rotates around a circular joint object.

Physics simulations.name: Physics joints - motor (Swiss SBB clock)
Physics simulations.desc: A complex example showing motors on a real clock.

Physics simulations.name: Physics joints and motor - mixing objects with a motor
Mouse interactions with physics
Physics simulations.desc: Shows how you can use the mouse to interact with physics objects.
